Article 5: Development Standards 5-79
Sign Standards (SI) 5
5.71 SI-06: Institutional Sign Standards
This Sign Standards (SI) section applies to the following zoning district:
The following standards apply:
A. Project Applicability:
1. Single-tenant Building:
a. Permanent Signs: Wall, ground, awning, window, and display board signs shall be permitted for singletenant
buildings provided the conditions specified for single-tenant buildings are met, and the cumulative
square footage of all permanent signs does not exceed one and one-half (1 ½) square feet of sign area per
linear foot of front facade or the cumulative maximum as prescribed in the tables below for each type of
sign, whichever is less.
b. Temporary Signs: Standard temporary and special temporary signs shall be permitted for single-tenant
buildings provided the conditions specified for single-tenant buildings are met.
2. Multiple-tenant Building: Multiple-tenant buildings are not recognized in this zoning district. Therefore, no
special sign provision are included for them in Section 5.71: Institutional Sign Standards.
B. Permanent Signs: Permanent signs shall be permitted as follows:
1. Wall Signs: Wall signs shall be permitted on single-tenant buildings provided the following conditions are met.
All wall signs shall count toward the maximum cumulative square footage for permanent signs.
Wall Signs Single-tenant Building
Maximum Quantity 2 per facade, not to exceed 4 cumulatively
Sign’s Setback from ROW Up to 50 ft 51 - 100 ft 101 - 150 ft 151 - 200 ft 201 - 250 ft 251+ ft
Maximum Sign Area per Facade 3 sq ft 9 sq ft 17 sq ft 28 sq ft 42 sq ft 50 sq ft
Maximum Sign Height 80% of the height of a spandrel panel or 10 feet, whichever is less
Changeable Copy Ratio 40% of the sign area may be changeable copy
Maximum Projection From Building 8 inches
a. Changeable Copy: If changeable copy is used, it shall be an integrated component of the sign and shall
only utilize cyclical messages or static messages, regardless if the sign is capable of animated messages.
b. Illumination: Wall signs may be illuminated internally or externally.
2. Ground Signs: Ground signs shall be permitted on single-tenant buildings provided the following conditions
are met. All ground signs shall be counted toward the maximum cumulative square footage for permanent signs.
Ground Sign Single-tenant Building
Maximum Quantity 1; or 2 for corner lots with a minimum of 500 feet of combined street frontage
Street Classification (see Section 5.80) Corridor 1 Corridor 2 Corridor 3 Corridor 4
Maximum Sign Area 48 39 24 24
Maximum Sign Height 12 feet maximum
Changeable Copy Ratio 40% of sign area may be changeable copy
a. Double-sided: If a ground sign has two (2) identical sides, back-to-back, only one (1) side’s area counts
toward the maximum cumulative square footage.
b. Location: A ground sign shall be located as follows:
i. Outside the Vision Clearance Triangle; and
ii. The leading edge of the sign shall be at least five (5) feet but no greater than ten (10) feet from the
street right-of-way; and
iii. All portions of the sign shall be at least five (5) feet from the side property line or edge of pavement.
c. Sign Separation: When two (2) ground signs are permitted on the same lot, they shall be seventy (70)
feet or more from one (1) another (measured using the shortest tangent) and located along different street
frontages.
d. Changeable Copy: If changeable copy is used, it shall be an integrated component of the sign and shall
only utilize cyclical messages or static messages, regardless if the sign is capable of animated messages.
e. Illumination: A ground sign may be illuminated internally or by externally-mounted ground lighting.

5. Display Board Signs: Display board signs shall be permitted provided the following conditions are met.
Examples of display board signs include permanently affixed bulletin boards or encased display boards for
posting of menus, specials, events, performances, and other temporary postings. Display board signs shall not
be counted toward the maximum cumulative square footage for permanent signs.
Display Board Signs Single-tenant Building Multiple-tenant Building
Maximum Quantity 1 not permitted
Maximum Sign Area 40 square feet not permitted
Height Above Ground 6 feet maximum not permitted
a. Design: The display board sign shall be framed with wood, metal, or other durable material and be
permanently attached to the building; or be a designated space on the building.
b. Postings: Postings on the display board sign shall not exceed the size of the display board sign. Postings
shall not be required to obtain any type of permit.
C. Temporary Signs: Any combination of standard temporary and special temporary signs shall be permitted for
single-tenant buildings provided the following conditions are met.
1. Location: Temporary signs shall be located outside the Vision Clearance Triangle and a minimum of ten (10)
feet from any right-of-way, or edge of pavement associated with a street or driveway.
2. Illumination: Temporary signs shall not be illuminated.
3. Standard Temporary Signs: Standard temporary signs shall be permitted as follows.
a. Type: A standard temporary sign shall be a yard sign. Examples of standard temporary signs include sale
of property, special sale, and special event signs.
b. Quantity: One (1) standard temporary sign shall be permitted per lot frontage, plus one (1) additional
sign for each 300 feet of street frontage. For corner lots, no two (2) standard temporary signs on separate
frontages shall be closer than 150 feet, measured using the shortest tangent.
c. Sign Area: The sign area for a standard temporary sign shall not exceed twenty-four (24) square feet per side.
d. Height Above Ground: The sign copy of a standard temporary sign shall be no more than eight (8) feet above
the ground. The sign structure shall not be greater than 120% taller than the sign copy.
e. Duration: A standard temporary sign may stay in place for the duration of the temporary event. The
standard temporary sign may be put in place up to seven (7) days prior to the temporary event. All
standard temporary signs shall be taken down within five (5) days after the standard temporary sign’s
purpose no longer exists.
Article
Article 5: Development Standards 5-81
Sign Standards (SI) 5
4. Special Temporary Signs: Special temporary signs shall be permitted provided the following conditions are
met. The following conditions apply to single-tenant buildings unless otherwise specified.
a. Type: Special temporary signs shall include banner signs, yard signs, A-frame signs, or self-standing signs.
Examples for the use of a special temporary sign include a community event or special short-term sale.
b. Quantity: One (1) special temporary sign shall be permitted per lot frontage, plus one (1) additional
sign for each 300 feet of street frontage. For corner lots, no two (2) special temporary signs on separate
frontages shall be closer than 150 feet, measured using the shortest tangent.
c. Sign Area: The sign area for a special temporary sign shall not exceed fifty (50) square feet per side.
d. Height Above Ground: A special temporary sign shall not exceed eight (8) feet above the ground if
freestanding, or no higher than the roofline if mounted to a building.
e. Pennants, Streamers, and Strings of Flags: Pennants, streamers, and strings of flags without commercial
messages or branding may be used in any quantity and at any height on the site in addition to the special
temporary signs listed above. However, the duration shall comply with the following provision.
f. Duration: A special temporary sign may stay in place for up to thirty (30) continuous days, but no more
than ninety (90) total days in any calendar year.
Town of Brownsburg Unified Development Ordinance
Article
5-82
Sign Standards (SI) 5
5.72 SI-07: Neighborhood Commercial Sign Standards
This Sign Standards (SI) section applies to the following zoning district:
The following standards apply:
A. Project Applicability:
1. Single-tenant Building:
a. Permanent Signs: Wall, ground, awning, window, drive-up menu, and display board signs shall be
permitted for single-tenant buildings provided the conditions specified for single-tenant buildings are met,
and the cumulative square footage of all permanent signs does not exceed two (2) square feet of sign area
per linear foot of front facade or the cumulative maximum as prescribed in the tables below for each type
of sign, whichever is less.
b. Temporary Signs: Standard temporary and special temporary signs shall be permitted for single-tenant
buildings provided the conditions specified for single-tenant buildings are met.
2. Multiple-tenant Building:
a. Permanent Signs: Wall, gateway, awning, window, drive-up menu, and display board signs shall be
permitted for multiple-tenant buildings provided the conditions specified for multiple-tenant buildings are
met, and the cumulative square footage of all permanent signs does not exceed two (2) square feet of sign
area per linear foot of front facade, or the cumulative maximum as prescribed in the tables below for each
type of sign, whichever is less.
b. Temporary Signs: Standard temporary and special temporary signs shall be permitted for multiple-tenant
buildings provided the conditions specified for multiple-tenant buildings are met.
B. Permanent Signs: Permanent signs shall be permitted as follows:
1. Wall Signs: Wall signs shall be permitted on single-tenant buildings and multiple-tenant buildings provided the
following conditions are met. All wall signs shall count toward the maximum cumulative square footage for
permanent signs.
Wall Signs Single-tenant Building
Maximum Quantity 2 per facade, not to exceed 4 cumulatively
Sign’s Setback from ROW Up to 50 ft 51 - 100 ft 101 - 150 ft 151 - 200 ft 201 - 250 ft 251+ ft
Maximum Sign Area per Facade 4 sq ft 11 sq ft 21 sq ft 34 sq ft 51 sq ft 60 sq ft
Maximum Sign Height 80% of the height of a spandrel panel or 10 feet, whichever is less
Changeable Copy Ratio 40% of the sign area may be changeable copy
Maximum Projection From Building 12 inches
Wall Signs Multiple-tenant Building
Maximum Quantity 1 per tenant space, plus 1 additional per corner space if located on the side
facade
Sign’s Setback from ROW Up to 50 ft 51 - 100 ft 101 - 150 ft 151 - 200 ft 201 - 250 ft 251+ ft
Maximum Sign Area per Facade 3 sq ft 8 sq ft 16 sq ft 26 sq ft 38 sq ft 45 sq ft
Maximum Sign Height 80% of the height of a spandrel panel or 6 feet, whichever is less
Changeable Copy Ratio 40% of the sign area may be changeable copy
Maximum Projection From Building 12 inches
a. Changeable Copy: If changeable copy is used, it shall be an integrated component of the sign and shall
only utilize cyclical messages or static messages, regardless if the sign is capable of animated messages.
b. Illumination: Wall signs may be illuminated internally or externally.
c. Projecting Sign Substitution: One (1) permitted wall sign may be substituted for one (1) projecting sign as
described below:
i. Maximum Area: The maximum sign area of the projecting sign shall not exceed twenty (20) square feet.
ii. Maximum Projection: The maximum projection from the building shall not exceed six (6) feet.
iii. Clearance to the Ground: Nine (9) feet if above a sidewalk, door, or other pedestrian area; and
fourteen (14) feet if above a driveway or other vehicular way.
d. Multiple-tenant Building Consistency: The sign envelope that tenants may use and the regulations to
maintain consistent sign appearance shall be identified during the permitting process. The sign envelope
shall not exceed 150% of the allowable wall sign area for each tenant space.
Article
Article 5: Development Standards 5-83
Sign Standards (SI) 5
2. Ground Signs: Ground signs shall be permitted for single-tenant buildings provided the following conditions
are met. See Subsection 5.72(B)(3) Gateway Signs below for multiple-tenant buildings. All ground signs
shall be counted toward the maximum cumulative square footage for permanent signs. Ground Signs are not
permitted for multiple-tenant buildings.
Ground Sign Single-tenant Building
Maximum Quantity 1; or 2 for corner lots with a minimum of 500 feet of combined street frontage
Street Classification (see Section 5.80) Corridor 1 Corridor 2 Corridor 3 Corridor 4
Maximum Sign Area 50 41 25 25
Maximum Sign Height 12 feet maximum
Changeable Copy Ratio 40% of sign area may be changeable copy
a. Double-sided: If a ground sign has two (2) identical sides, back-to-back, only one (1) side’s area counts
toward the maximum cumulative square footage.
b. Location: A ground sign shall be located as follows:
i. Outside the Vision Clearance Triangle; and
ii. The leading edge of the sign shall be at least five (5) feet but no greater than ten (10) feet from the
street right-of-way; and
iii. All portions of the sign shall be at least five (5) feet from the side property line or edge of pavement.
c. Sign Separation: When two (2) ground signs are permitted on the same lot, they shall be 100 feet or more
from each other, measured using the shortest tangent and located along different street frontages.
d. Changeable Copy: If changeable copy is used, it shall be an integrated component of the sign and shall
only utilize cyclical messages or static messages, regardless if the sign is capable of animated messages.
e. Illumination: A ground sign may be illuminated internally or by externally-mounted ground lighting.
3. Gateway Signs: Gateway signs shall be permitted for multiple-tenant buildings that have a minimum of two (2)
tenant spaces, and provided the following conditions are met. See Subsection 5.72(B)(2) Ground Signs above
for single-tenant buildings. All gateway signs shall be counted toward the maximum cumulative square footage
for permanent signs. Gateway Signs are not permitted for single-tenant buildings.
Gateway Sign Multiple-tenant Building
Maximum Quantity 1; or 2 for corner lots with a minimum of 500 feet of combined street frontage
Street Classification (see Section 5.80) Corridor 1 Corridor 2 Corridor 3 Corridor 4
Maximum Sign Area 80 65 39 39
Maximum Sign Height 12 feet maximum
Changeable Copy Ratio 40% of sign area may be changeable copy
a. Double-sided: If a gateway sign has two (2) identical sides, back-to-back, only one (1) side’s area counts
toward the maximum cumulative square footage.
b. Location: A gateway sign shall be located outside the Vision Clearance Triangle and a minimum of ten
(10) feet from any existing or proposed right-of-way, or edge of pavement associated with a street or
driveway; and a gateway sign shall be setback ten (10) feet from all property lines.
c. Sign Separation: When two (2) ground signs are permitted on the same lot, they shall be 200 feet or more
from each other, measured using the shortest tangent and located along different street frontages.
d. Changeable Copy: If changeable copy is used, it shall be an integrated component of the sign and shall
only utilize cyclical messages or static messages, regardless if the sign is capable of animated messages.
e. Illumination: A gateway sign may be illuminated internally or by exterior mounted ground lighting.

Article 5: Development Standards 5-85
Sign Standards (SI) 5
C. Temporary Signs: Any combination of standard temporary and special temporary signs shall be permitted for
single-tenant buildings and multiple-tenant buildings provided the following conditions are met.
1. Location: Temporary signs shall be located outside the Vision Clearance Triangle and a minimum of ten (10)
feet from any right-of-way, or edge of pavement associated with a street or driveway.
2. Illumination: Temporary signs shall not be illuminated.
3. Standard Temporary Signs: Standard temporary signs shall be permitted as follows.
a. Type: A standard temporary sign shall be a yard sign. Examples of standard temporary signs include sale
of property, special sale, and special offer signs.
b. Quantity:
i. Single-tenant Buildings: One (1) standard temporary sign shall be permitted per lot frontage, plus one
(1) additional sign for each 300 feet of street frontage. For corner lots, no two (2) standard temporary
signs on separate frontages shall be closer than 150 feet, measured using the shortest tangent.
ii. Multiple-tenant Buildings: One (1) standard temporary sign shall be permitted for each tenant.
c. Sign Area: The sign area for a standard temporary sign shall not exceed sixteen (16) square feet per side.
d. Height Above Ground: The sign copy of a standard temporary sign shall be no more than eight (8) feet above
the ground. The sign structure shall not be greater than 120% taller than the sign copy.
e. Duration: A standard temporary sign may stay in place for the duration of the temporary event. The
standard temporary sign may be put in place up to seven (7) days prior to the temporary event. All
standard temporary signs shall be taken down within five (5) days after the standard temporary sign’s
purpose no longer exists.
4. Special Temporary Signs: Special temporary signs shall be permitted provided the following conditions are
met. The following conditions apply to single-tenant buildings and multiple-tenant buildings unless otherwise
specified.
a. Type: Special temporary signs shall include banner signs, yard signs, A-frame signs, or self-standing signs.
Examples for the use of a special temporary sign include a community event or special short-term sale.
b. Quantity:
i. Single-tenant Buildings: Two (2) special temporary sign shall be permitted per lot at any one time
ii. Multiple-tenant Buildings: One (1) special temporary sign shall be permitted for each tenant.
c. Sign Area: The sign area for a special temporary sign shall not exceed fifty (50) square feet per side.
d. Height Above Ground: A special temporary sign shall not exceed eight (8) feet above the ground if
freestanding, or no higher than the roofline if mounted to a building.
e. Pennants, Streamers, and Strings of Flags: Pennants, streamers, and strings of flags without commercial
messages or branding may be used in any quantity and at any height on the site in addition to the special
temporary signs listed above. However, the duration shall comply with the following provision.
f. Duration: A special temporary sign may stay in place for seven (7) continuous days, no more than four (4)
times in any calendar year.

5.73 SI-08: Urban Commercial Sign Standards
This Sign Standards (SI) section applies to the following zoning district:
The following standards apply:
A. Project Applicability:
1. Single-tenant Building:
a. Permanent Signs: Wall, awning, window, and display board signs shall be permitted for single-tenant
buildings provided the conditions specified for single-tenant buildings are met, and the cumulative square
footage of all permanent signs does not exceed two and one-half (2 ½) square feet of sign area per linear
foot of front facade or the cumulative maximum as prescribed in the tables below for each type of sign,
whichever is less.
b. Temporary Signs: Standard temporary and special temporary signs shall be permitted for single-tenant
buildings provided the conditions specified for single-tenant buildings are met.
2. Multiple-tenant Building:
a. Permanent Signs: Wall, awning, window, display board, and tenant listing signs shall be permitted for
multiple-tenant buildings provided the conditions specified for multiple-tenant buildings are met, and the
cumulative square footage of all permanent signs does not exceed two and one-half (2 ½) square feet of
sign area per linear foot of front facade, or the cumulative maximum as prescribed in the tables below for
each type of sign, whichever is less.
b. Temporary Signs: Standard temporary and special temporary signs shall be permitted for multiple-tenant
buildings provided the conditions specified for multiple-tenant buildings are met.
B. Permanent Signs: Permanent signs shall be permitted as follows:
1. Wall Signs: Wall signs shall be permitted on single-tenant buildings and multiple-tenant buildings provided the
following conditions are met. All wall signs shall count toward the maximum cumulative square footage for
permanent signs.

cumulatively

per corner space if located on the side
facade

foot of facade for 80% of facade

shall not exceed 150% of the allowable wall sign area for each tenant space.

a. Double-sided: If a projecting sign has two (2) identical sides, back-to-back, only one (1) side’s area counts
toward the maximum cumulative square footage.
b. Location: A projecting sign shall be located within fifteen (15) feet of the center of the primary entrance.
c. Projection: Projecting signs and all supporting apparatuses of projecting signs shall not project more than
eight (8) feet from the building facade. However, a projecting sign shall be at least two (2) feet from the
vertical alignment of a curb or driving surface. A projecting sign that encroaches into the right-of-way
shall first be approved by the Town Council or Indiana Department of Transportation.
d. Sign Separation: No two (2) projecting signs shall be within twenty (20) feet of one another, measured
using the shortest tangent.
e. Illumination: A projecting sign may be illuminated by externally-mounted lighting.

Article
5-88
Sign Standards (SI) 5
6. Tenant Listing Sign: A tenant listing sign shall be permitted for a multiple-tenant building that has tenant
spaces on upper floors and a common lobby or stairway. Tenant listing signs shall not be counted toward the
maximum cumulative square footage for permanent signs.
Tenant Listing Sign Single-tenant Building Multiple-tenant Building
Maximum Quantity not permitted 1 per common lobby or stairway leading
to upper floor tenant spaces
Maximum Sign Area not permitted 6 square feet per sign
Height Above Ground not permitted 7 feet maximum
a. Location: The tenant listing sign shall be fully located within ten (10) feet of the primary entrance to the
common lobby or stairway leading to upper floor tenant spaces, and shall be a wall sign.
C. Temporary Signs: Any combination of standard temporary and special temporary signs shall be permitted for
single-tenant buildings and multiple-tenant buildings provided the following conditions are met.
1. Location: Temporary signs shall either be fully outside the public right-of-way, be located on a sidewalk, or
in a first floor window. However, the placement of a temporary sign shall not constrain a sidewalk to less than
five (5) feet of clear-way for pedestrians. A temporary sign that encroaches into the right-of-way shall first be
approved by the Town Council or Indiana Department of Transportation.
2. Illumination: Temporary signs shall not be illuminated.
3. Standard Temporary Signs: Standard temporary signs shall be permitted provided the following conditions are
met. The following conditions apply to single-tenant buildings and multiple-tenant buildings unless otherwise
specified.
a. Type: A standard temporary sign shall be an A-frame sign or self-standing sign. Examples of standard
temporary signs include sale of property, special sale, and special offer signs.
b. Quantity:
i. Single-tenant Buildings: One (1) standard temporary sign shall be permitted per storefront, plus one
(1) additional sign for corner storefronts. For corner storefronts, no two (2) standard temporary signs
shall be closer than 40 feet, measured along the front facade.
ii. Multiple-tenant Buildings: One (1) standard temporary sign shall be permitted for each tenant.
c. Sign Area: The sign area for a standard temporary sign shall not exceed eight (8) square feet per side.
d. Height Above Ground: No part of a standard temporary sign shall be more than five (5) feet above the
ground.
e. Duration: A standard temporary sign may stay in place for the duration of the temporary event. The
standard temporary sign may be put in place up to seven (7) days prior to the temporary event. All
standard temporary signs shall be taken down within five (5) days after the standard temporary sign’s
purpose no longer exists.
4. Special Temporary Signs: Special temporary signs shall be permitted provided the following conditions are
met. The following conditions apply to single-tenant buildings and multiple-tenant buildings unless otherwise
specified.
a. Type: Special temporary signs shall include banner signs, A-frame signs, or self-standing signs. Examples
for the use of a special temporary sign include a community event or special short-term sale.
b. Quantity:
i. Single-tenant Buildings: One (1) special temporary sign shall be permitted per building at any one time.
ii. Multiple-tenant Buildings: One (1) special temporary sign shall be permitted for each building at any time.
c. Sign Area: The sign area for a special temporary sign shall not exceed fifty (50) square feet per side.
d. Height Above Ground: A special temporary sign shall not exceed eight (8) feet above the ground if
freestanding, or no higher than the roofline if mounted to a building.
e. Pennants, Streamers, and Strings of Flags: Pennants, streamers, and strings of flags without commercial
messages or branding may be used in any quantity and at any height on the site in addition to the special
temporary signs listed above. However, the duration shall comply with the following provision.
f. Duration: A special temporary sign may stay in place for seven (7) continuous days, no more than four (4)
times in any calendar year.
Article
Article 5: Development Standards 5-89
Sign Standards (SI) 5
5.74 SI-09: Moderate Intensity Commercial Sign Standards
This Sign Standards (SI) section applies to the following zoning districts:
The following standards apply:
A. Project Applicability:
1. Single-tenant Building:
a. Permanent Signs: Wall, ground, pole, awning, window, drive-up menu, and display board signs shall be
permitted for single-tenant buildings provided the conditions specified for single-tenant buildings are met
and the cumulative square footage of all permanent signs does not exceed three (3) square feet of sign area
per linear foot of front facade or the cumulative maximum as prescribed in the tables below for each type
of sign, whichever is less.
b. Temporary Signs: Standard temporary and special temporary signs shall be permitted for single-tenant
buildings provided the conditions specified for single-tenant buildings are met.
c. Limitations: Only one (1) freestanding permanent sign (i.e. ground sign or pole sign) shall be permitted
per lot, except corner lots that qualify for two (2) of the same type of sign.
2. Multiple-tenant Building:
a. Permanent Signs: Wall, gateway, pole, awning, window, drive-up menu, and display board signs shall be
permitted for multiple-tenant buildings provided the conditions specified for multiple-tenant buildings are
met and the cumulative square footage of all permanent signs does not exceed three (3) square feet of sign
area per linear foot of front facade, or the cumulative maximum as prescribed in the tables below for each
type of sign, whichever is less.
b. Temporary Signs: Standard temporary and special temporary signs shall be permitted for multiple-tenant
buildings provided the conditions specified for multiple-tenant buildings are met.
B. Permanent Signs: Permanent signs shall be permitted as follows:
1. Wall Signs: Wall signs shall be permitted on single-tenant buildings and multiple-tenant buildings provided the
following conditions are met. All wall signs shall count toward the maximum cumulative square footage for
permanent signs.
Wall Signs Single-tenant Building
Maximum Quantity 2 per facade, not to exceed 5 cumulatively
Sign’s Setback from ROW Up to 50 ft 51 - 100 ft 101 - 150 ft 151 - 200 ft 201 - 250 ft 251+ ft
Maximum Sign Area - Front Facade 21 sq ft 55 sq ft 104 sq ft 171 sq ft 253 sq ft 300 sq ft
Maximum Sign Area - Side/Rear Facade 7 sq ft 18 sq ft 35 sq ft 57 sq ft 84 sq ft 100 sq ft
Maximum Sign Height 80% of the height of a spandrel panel or 10 feet, whichever is less
Changeable Copy Ratio 40% of the sign area may be changeable copy
Maximum Projection From Building 18 inches
Wall Signs Multiple-tenant Building
Maximum Quantity 1 per tenant space, plus 1 additional per corner space if located on the side
facade
Sign’s Setback from ROW Up to 50 ft 51 - 100 ft 101 - 150 ft 151 - 200 ft 201 - 250 ft 251+ ft
Maximum Sign Area - Front Facade 14 sq ft 36 sq ft 70 sq ft 114 sq ft 169 sq ft 200 sq ft
Maximum Sign Area - Side/Rear Facade 5 sq ft 14 sq ft 26 sq ft 43 sq ft 63 sq ft 75 sq ft
Maximum Sign Height 80% of the height of a spandrel panel or 6 feet, whichever is less
Changeable Copy Ratio 40% of the sign area may be changeable copy
Maximum Projection From Building 18 inches
Changeable Copy: If changeable copy is used, it shall be an integrated component of the sign and shall only
utilize cyclical messages or static messages, regardless if the sign is capable of animated messages.
a. Illumination: Wall signs may be illuminated internally or externally.
b. Canopy: The facia (i.e. parapet) of a gas station or other permanent, attached or detached, canopy may be
used for wall signs. Any sign placed on the canopy’s facia (i.e. parapet) shall not exceed eighty percent
(80%) of the facia’s height.

5-90
Sign Standards (SI) 5
c. Multiple-tenant Building Consistency: The sign envelope that tenants may use and the regulations to
maintain consistent sign appearance shall be identified during the permitting process. The sign envelope
shall not exceed 150% of the allowable wall sign area for each tenant space.
2. Ground Signs: Ground signs shall be permitted on single-tenant buildings provided the following conditions
are met. See Subsection 5.74(B)(4) Gateway Signs below for multiple-tenant buildings. All ground signs
shall be counted toward the maximum cumulative square footage for permanent signs. Ground Signs are not
permitted for multiple-tenant buildings.
Ground Sign Single-tenant Building
Maximum Quantity 1; or 2 for corner lots with a minimum of 500 feet of combined street frontage
Street Classification (see Section 5.80) Corridor 1 Corridor 2 Corridor 3 Corridor 4
Maximum Sign Area 120 97 59 59
Maximum Sign Height 12 feet maximum
Changeable Copy Ratio 40% of sign area may be changeable copy
a. Double-sided: If a ground sign has two (2) identical sides, back-to-back, only one (1) side’s area counts
toward the maximum cumulative square footage.
b. Location: A ground sign shall be located as follows:
i. Outside the Vision Clearance Triangle; and
ii. The leading edge of the sign shall be at least five (5) feet but no greater than ten (10) feet from the
street right-of-way; and
iii. All portions of the sign shall be at least five (5) feet from the side property line or edge of pavement.
c. Sign Separation: When two (2) ground signs are permitted on the same lot, they shall be 200 feet or more
from each other, measured using the shortest tangent and located along different street frontages.
d. Changeable Copy: If changeable copy is used, it shall be an integrated component of the sign and shall
only utilize cyclical messages or static messages, regardless if the sign is capable of animated messages.
e. Illumination: A ground sign may be illuminated internally or by externally-mounted ground lighting.
3. Pole Signs: Pole signs shall be permitted for single-tenant buildings and multiple-tenant buildings provided the
following conditions are met. All pole signs shall be counted toward the maximum cumulative square footage
for permanent signs. Pole Signs are not permitted for multiple-tenant buildings.
Pole Sign Single-tenant Building
Maximum Quantity 1
Street Classification (see Section 5.80) Corridor 1 Corridor 2 Corridor 3 Corridor 4
Maximum Sign Area 120 97 59 59
Maximum Sign Height 25 23 19 17
Changeable Copy Ratio 40% of sign area may be changeable copy
a. Double-sided: If a pole sign has two (2) identical sides, back-to-back, only one (1) side’s area counts
toward the maximum cumulative square feet.
b. Location: A pole sign shall be located outside the Vision Clearance Triangle and a minimum of ten (10)
feet from any existing or proposed right-of-way, or edge of pavement associated with a street or driveway;
and a pole sign shall be setback ten (10) feet from all property lines.
c. Changeable Copy: If changeable copy is used, it shall be an integrated component of the sign and shall
only utilize cyclical messages or static messages, regardless if the sign is capable of animated messages.
d. Illumination: A pole sign may be illuminated internally, but shall not be illuminated by externally-mounted
lights.

Article
5-92
Sign Standards (SI) 5
7. Drive-up Menu Sign: Drive-up menu signs shall be permitted for single-tenant buildings and multiple-tenant
buildings provided the lot has a permitted, operable, and in-use drive-up window and provided the following
conditions are met. Drive-up window menu signs shall not count toward the maximum cumulative square
footage for permanent signs.
Drive-up Window Menu Sign Single-tenant Building Multiple-tenant Building
Maximum Quantity 2 per ordering lane 2 per tenant with drive-up
Maximum Sign Area 50 square feet per ordering lane 50 square feet per ordering lane
Height Above Ground 8 feet maximum 8 feet maximum
a. Design: A drive-up menu sign shall be single-sided.
b. Location: A drive-up menu sign shall be located in the drive-up window lane and face vehicles in that lane.
c. Illumination: Drive-up menu signs may be illuminated internally or externally.
8. Display Board Signs: Display board signs shall be permitted on single-tenant and multiple-tenant buildings
provided the following conditions are met. Examples of display board signs include permanently affixed
bulletin boards or encased display boards for menus, specials, events, performances, and other temporary
postings. Display board signs shall not be counted toward the maximum cumulative square footage for
permanent signs.
Display Board Signs Single-tenant Building Multiple-tenant Building
Maximum Quantity 1 1 per tenant
Maximum Sign Area 50 square feet 20 square feet per tenant
Height Above Ground 6 feet maximum 6 feet maximum
a. Design: The display board sign shall be framed with wood, metal, or other durable material and be
permanently attached to the building; or be a designated space on the building.
b. Postings: Postings on the display board sign shall not exceed the size of the display board sign. Postings
shall not be required to obtain any type of permit.
C. Temporary Signs: Any combination of standard temporary and special temporary signs shall be permitted for
single-tenant buildings and multiple-tenant buildings provided the following conditions are met.
1. Location: Temporary signs shall be located outside the Vision Clearance Triangle and a minimum of ten (10)
feet from any right-of-way, or edge of pavement associated with a street or driveway.
2. Illumination: Temporary signs shall not be illuminated.
3. Standard Temporary Signs: Standard temporary signs shall be permitted provided the following conditions are
met. The following conditions apply to single-tenant buildings and multiple-tenant buildings unless otherwise
specified.
a. Type: A standard temporary sign shall be an A-frame sign, self-standing sign, or yard sign. Examples of
standard temporary signs include sale of property, special sale, and special offer signs.
b. Quantity:
i. Single-tenant Buildings: One (1) standard temporary sign shall be permitted per lot frontage, plus one
(1) additional sign for each 300 feet of street frontage. For corner lots, no two (2) standard temporary
signs on separate frontages shall be closer than 150 feet, measured using the shortest tangent.
ii. Multiple-tenant Buildings: One (1) standard temporary sign shall be permitted for each tenant.
c. Sign Area: The sign area for a standard temporary sign shall not exceed thirty-two (32) square feet per side.
d. Height Above Ground: The sign copy of a standard temporary sign shall be no more than eight (8) feet above
the ground. The sign structure shall not be greater than 120% taller than the sign copy.
e. Duration: A standard temporary sign may stay in place for the duration of the temporary event. The
standard temporary sign may be put in place up to seven (7) days prior to the temporary event. All
standard temporary signs shall be taken down within five (5) days after the standard temporary sign’s
purpose no longer exists.

Article 5: Development Standards 5-93
Sign Standards (SI) 5
4. Special Temporary Signs: Special temporary signs shall be permitted provided the following conditions are
met. The following conditions apply to single-tenant buildings and multiple-tenant buildings unless otherwise
specified.
a. Type: Special temporary signs shall include banner signs, yard signs, A-frame signs, or self-standing signs.
Examples for the use of a special temporary sign include a community event or special short-term sale.
b. Quantity:
i. Single-tenant Buildings: Two (2) special temporary signs shall be permitted at any one (1) time for a lot.
ii. Multiple-tenant Buildings: One (1) special temporary sign shall be permitted for each building at any
given time.
c. Sign Area: The sign area for a special temporary sign shall not exceed fifty (50) square feet per side.
d. Height Above Ground: A special temporary sign shall not exceed eight (8) feet above the ground if
freestanding, or no higher than the roofline if mounted to a building.
e. Pennants, Streamers, and Strings of Flags: Pennants, streamers, and strings of flags without commercial
messages or branding may be used in any quantity and at any height on the site in addition to the special
temporary signs listed above. However, the duration shall comply with the following provision.
f. Duration: A special temporary sign may stay in place for seven (7) continuous days, no more than four (4)
times in any calendar year.

5.76 SI-11: Highway Commercial Sign Standards
This Sign Standards (SI) section applies to the following zoning district:
The following standards apply:
A. Project Applicability:
1. Single-tenant Building:
a. Permanent Signs: Wall, ground, pole, awning, window, drive-up menu, and display board signs shall be
permitted for single-tenant buildings provided the conditions specified for single-tenant buildings are met
and the cumulative square footage of all permanent signs does not exceed three (3) square feet of sign area
per linear foot of front facade or the cumulative maximum as prescribed in the tables below for each type
of sign, whichever is less.
b. Temporary Signs: Standard temporary and special temporary signs shall be permitted for single-tenant
buildings provided the conditions specified for single-tenant buildings are met.
c. Limitations: Only one (1) freestanding permanent sign (i.e. ground sign or pole sign) shall be permitted
per lot, except corner lots that qualify for two (2) of the same type of sign.
2. Multiple-tenant Building:
a. Permanent Signs: Wall, gateway, pole, awning, window, drive-up menu, and display board signs shall be
permitted for multiple-tenant buildings provided the conditions specified for multiple-tenant buildings are
met and the cumulative square footage of all permanent signs does not exceed three (3) square feet of sign
area per linear foot of front facade, or the cumulative maximum as prescribed in the tables below for each
type of sign, whichever is less.
b. Temporary Signs: Standard temporary and special temporary signs shall be permitted for multiple-tenant
buildings provided the conditions specified for multiple-tenant buildings are met.
B. Permanent Signs: Permanent signs shall be permitted as follows:
1. Wall Signs: Wall signs shall be permitted on single-tenant buildings and multiple-tenant buildings provided the
following conditions are met. All wall signs shall count toward the maximum cumulative square footage for
permanent signs.
Wall Signs Single-tenant Building
Maximum Quantity 2 per facade, not to exceed 6 cumulatively
Sign’s Setback from ROW Up to 50 ft 51 - 100 ft 101 - 150 ft 151 - 200 ft 201 - 250 ft 251+ ft
Maximum Sign Area - Front Facade 21 sq ft 55 sq ft 104 sq ft 171 sq ft 253 sq ft 300 sq ft
Maximum Sign Area - Side/Rear Facade 7 sq ft 18 sq ft 35 sq ft 57 sq ft 84 sq ft 100 sq ft
Maximum Sign Height 80% of the height of a spandrel panel or 20 feet, whichever is less
Changeable Copy Ratio 40% of the sign area may be changeable copy
Maximum Projection From Building 18 inches
Wall Signs Multiple-tenant Building
Maximum Quantity 1 per tenant space, plus 1 additional per corner space if located on the side
facade
Sign’s Setback from ROW Up to 50 ft 51 - 100 ft 101 - 150 ft 151 - 200 ft 201 - 250 ft 251+ ft
Maximum Sign Area - Front Facade 14 sq ft 36 sq ft 70 sq ft 114 sq ft 169 sq ft 200 sq ft
Maximum Sign Area - Side/Rear Facade 5 sq ft 14 sq ft 26 sq ft 43 sq ft 63 sq ft 75 sq ft
Maximum Sign Height 80% of the height of a spandrel panel or 8 feet, whichever is less
Changeable Copy Ratio 40% of the sign area may be changeable copy
Maximum Projection From Building 18 inches
a. Changeable Copy: If changeable copy is used, it shall be an integrated component of the sign and shall
only utilize cyclical messages or static messages, regardless if the sign is capable of animated messages.
b. Illumination: Wall signs may be illuminated internally or externally.
c. Canopy: The facia (i.e. parapet) of a gas station or other permanent, attached or detached, canopy may be
used for wall signs. Any sign placed on the canopy’s facia (i.e. parapet) shall not exceed eighty percent
(80%) of the facia’s height.
Town of Brownsburg Unified Development Ordinance
Article
5-100
Sign Standards (SI) 5
d. Multiple-tenant Building Consistency: The sign envelope that tenants may use and the regulations to
maintain consistent sign appearance shall be identified during the permitting process. The sign envelope
shall not exceed 150% of the allowable wall sign area for each tenant space.
2. Ground Signs: Ground signs shall be permitted on single-tenant buildings provided the following conditions
are met. See Subsection 5.76(B)(4) Gateway Signs below for multiple-tenant buildings. All ground signs
shall be counted toward the maximum cumulative square footage for permanent signs. Ground Signs are not
permitted for multiple-tenant buildings.
Ground Sign Single-tenant Building
Maximum Quantity 1; or 2 for corner lots with a minimum of 500 feet of combined street frontage
Street Classification (see Section 5.80) Corridor 1 Corridor 2 Corridor 3 Corridor 4
Maximum Sign Area 120 97 59 59
Maximum Sign Height 12 feet maximum
Changeable Copy Ratio 40% of sign area may be changeable copy
a. Double-sided: If a ground sign has two (2) identical sides, back-to-back, only one (1) side’s area counts
toward the maximum cumulative square footage.
b. Location: A ground sign shall be located as follows:
i. Outside the Vision Clearance Triangle; and
ii. The leading edge of the sign shall be at least five (5) feet but no greater than ten (10) feet from the
street right-of-way; and
iii. All portions of the sign shall be at least five (5) feet from the side property line or edge of pavement.
c. Sign Separation: When two (2) ground signs are permitted on the same lot, they shall be 200 feet or more
from each other, measured using the shortest tangent and located along different street frontages.
d. Changeable Copy: If changeable copy is used, it shall be an integrated component of the sign and shall
only utilize cyclical messages or static messages, regardless if the sign is capable of animated messages.
e. Illumination: A ground sign may be illuminated internally or by externally-mounted ground lighting.
3. Pole Signs: Pole signs shall be permitted for single-tenant buildings and multiple-tenant buildings provided the
following conditions are met. All pole signs shall be counted toward the maximum cumulative square footage
for permanent signs. Pole Signs are not permitted for multiple-tenant buildings.
Pole Sign Single-tenant Building

Street Classification (see Section 5.80) Corridor 1 Corridor 2 Corridor 3 Corridor 4

Changeable Copy Ratio 40% of sign area may be changeable copy
a. Double-sided: If a pole sign has two (2) identical sides, back-to-back, only one (1) side’s area counts
toward the maximum cumulative square feet.
b. Location: A pole sign shall be located outside the Vision Clearance Triangle and a minimum of ten (10)
feet from any existing or proposed right-of-way, or edge of pavement associated with a street or driveway;
and a pole sign shall be setback ten (10) feet from all property lines.
c. Changeable Copy: If changeable copy is used, it shall be an integrated component of the sign and shall
only utilize cyclical messages or static messages, regardless if the sign is capable of animated messages.
d. Illumination: A pole sign may be illuminated internally, but shall not be illuminated by externally-mounted
lights.

Article 5: Development Standards 5-101
Sign Standards (SI) 5
4. Gateway Signs: Gateway signs shall be permitted for multiple-tenant buildings that have a minimum of two
(2) tenant spaces, and provided the following conditions are met. See Subsection 5.76(B)(2) Ground Signs and
Subsection 5.76(B)(3) Pole Signs above for single-tenant buildings. All gateway signs shall be counted toward
the maximum cumulative square footage for permanent signs. Gateway Signs are not permitted for singletenant
buildings.
Gateway Sign Multiple-tenant Building
Maximum Quantity 1; or 2 for corner lots with a minimum of 800 feet of combined street frontage

Changeable Copy Ratio 40% of sign area may be changeable copy
a. Double-sided: If a gateway sign has two (2) identical sides, back-to-back, only one (1) side’s area counts
toward the maximum cumulative square footage.
b. Location: A gateway sign shall be located outside the Vision Clearance Triangle and a minimum of ten
(10) feet from any existing or proposed right-of-way, or edge of pavement associated with a street or
driveway; and a gateway sign shall be setback ten (10) feet from all property lines.
c. Changeable Copy: If changeable copy is used, it shall be an integrated component of the sign and shall
only utilize cyclical messages or static messages, regardless if the sign is capable of animated messages.
d. Illumination: A gateway sign may be illuminated internally or by externally-mounted ground lighting.
5. Awning Signs: Awning signs shall be permitted on single-tenant buildings and multiple-tenant buildings
provided the following conditions are met. All awning signs shall be counted toward the maximum cumulative
square footage for permanent signs.

b. Operability: Awnings, with an awning sign, that can retract shall count toward the cumulative sign area
whether in the retracted or extended position.
6. Window Signs: Window signs shall be permitted on single-tenant buildings and multiple-tenant buildings
provided the following conditions are met. Window signs shall not be counted toward the maximum cumulative
square footage for permanent signs.

Article
5-102
Sign Standards (SI) 5
7. Drive-up Menu Sign: Drive-up menu signs shall be permitted for single-tenant buildings and multiple-tenant
buildings provided the lot has a permitted, operable, and in-use drive-up window and provided the following
conditions are met. Drive-up window menu signs shall not count toward the maximum cumulative square
footage for permanent signs.
Drive-up Window Menu Sign Single-tenant Building Multiple-tenant Building
Maximum Quantity 2 per ordering lane 2 per tenant with drive-up
Maximum Sign Area 50 square feet per ordering lane 50 square feet per ordering lane
Height Above Ground 8 feet maximum 8 feet maximum
a. Design: A drive-up menu sign shall be single-sided.
b. Location: A drive-up menu sign shall be located in the drive-up window lane and face vehicles in that lane.
c. Illumination: Drive-up menu signs may be illuminated internally or externally.
8. Display Board Signs: Display board signs shall be permitted on single-tenant and multiple-tenant buildings
provided the following conditions are met. Examples of display board signs include permanently affixed
bulletin boards or encased display boards for menus, specials, events, performances, and other temporary
postings. Display board signs shall not be counted toward the maximum cumulative square footage for
permanent signs.
Display Board Signs Single-tenant Building Multiple-tenant Building
Maximum Quantity 1 1 per tenant
Maximum Sign Area 50 square feet 20 square feet per tenant
Height Above Ground 6 feet maximum 6 feet maximum
a. Design: The display board sign shall be framed with wood, metal, or other durable material and be
permanently attached to the building; or be a designated space on the building.
b. Postings: Postings on the display board sign shall not exceed the size of the display board sign. Postings
shall not be required to obtain any type of permit.
C. Temporary Signs: Any combination of standard temporary and special temporary signs shall be permitted for
single-tenant buildings and multiple-tenant buildings provided the following conditions are met.
1. Location: Temporary signs shall be located outside the Vision Clearance Triangle and a minimum of ten (10)
feet from any right-of-way, or edge of pavement associated with a street or driveway. Temporary signs shall be
located a minimum of five (5) feet from any right-of-way, edge of pavement, and curb associated with a street
or driveway.
2. Illumination: Temporary signs shall not be illuminated.
3. Standard Temporary Signs: Standard temporary signs shall be permitted provided the following conditions are
met. The following conditions apply to single-tenant buildings and multiple-tenant buildings unless otherwise
specified.
a. Type: A standard temporary sign shall be an A-frame sign, self-standing sign, or yard sign. Examples of
standard temporary signs include sale of property, special sale, and special offer signs.
b. Quantity:
i. Single-tenant Buildings: One (1) standard temporary sign shall be permitted per lot frontage, plus one
(1) additional sign for each 300 feet of street frontage. For corner lots, no two (2) standard temporary
signs on separate frontages shall be closer than 150 feet, measured using the shortest tangent.
ii. Multiple-tenant Buildings: One (1) standard temporary sign shall be permitted for each tenant.
c. Sign Area: The sign area for a standard temporary sign shall not exceed thirty-two (32) square feet per side.
d. Height Above Ground: The sign copy of a standard temporary sign shall be no more than ten (10) feet above
the ground. The sign structure shall not be greater than 120% taller than the sign copy.
e. Duration: A standard temporary sign may stay in place for the duration of the temporary event. The
standard temporary sign may be put in place up to seven (7) days prior to the temporary event. All
standard temporary signs shall be taken down within five (5) days after the standard temporary sign’s
purpose no longer exists.
Article
Article 5: Development Standards 5-103
Sign Standards (SI) 5
4. Special Temporary Signs: Special temporary signs shall be permitted provided the following conditions are
met. The following conditions apply to single-tenant buildings and multiple-tenant buildings unless otherwise
specified.
a. Type: Special temporary signs shall include banner signs, yard signs, A-frame signs, or self-standing signs.
Examples for the use of a special temporary sign include a community event or special short-term sale.
b. Quantity:
i. Single-tenant Buildings: Two (2) special temporary signs shall be permitted at any one (1) time for a lot.
ii. Multiple-tenant Buildings: One (1) special temporary sign shall be permitted for each building at any
given time.
c. Sign Area: The sign area for a special temporary sign shall not exceed fifty (50) square feet per side.
d. Height Above Ground: A special temporary sign shall not exceed eight (8) feet above the ground if
freestanding, or no higher than the roofline if mounted to a building.
e. Pennants, Streamers, and Strings of Flags: Pennants, streamers, and strings of flags without commercial
messages or branding may be used in any quantity and at any height on the site in addition to the special
temporary signs listed above. However, the duration shall comply with the following provision.
f. Duration: A special temporary sign may stay in place for seven (7) continuous days, no more than four (4)
times in any calendar year.
Town of Brownsburg Unified Development Ordinance
Article
5-104
Sign Standards (SI) 5
5.77 SI-12: Employment Center Sign Standards
This Sign Standards (SI) section applies to the following zoning district:
The following standards apply:
A. Project Applicability:
1. Single-tenant Building:
a. Permanent Signs: Wall, ground, awning, window, and display board signs shall be permitted for singletenant
buildings provided the conditions specified for single-tenant buildings are met and the cumulative
square footage of all permanent signs does not exceed two and one-half (2 ½) square feet of sign area per
linear foot of front facade or the cumulative maximum as prescribed in the tables below for each type of
sign, whichever is less.
b. Temporary Signs: Standard temporary and special temporary signs shall be permitted for single-tenant
buildings provided the conditions specified for single-tenant buildings are met.
2. Multiple-tenant Building:
a. Permanent Signs: Wall, gateway, awning, window, and display board signs shall be permitted for multipletenant
buildings provided the conditions specified for multiple-tenant buildings are met and the cumulative
square footage of all permanent signs does not exceed two and one-half (2 ½) square feet of sign area per
linear foot of front facade, or the cumulative maximum as prescribed in the tables below for each type of
sign, whichever is less.
b. Temporary Signs: Standard temporary and special temporary signs shall be permitted for multiple-tenant
buildings provided the conditions specified for multiple-tenant buildings are met.
B. Permanent Signs: Permanent signs shall be permitted as follows:
1. Wall Signs: Wall signs shall be permitted on single-tenant buildings and multiple-tenant buildings provided the
following conditions are met. All wall signs shall count toward the maximum cumulative square footage for
permanent signs.
Wall Signs Single-tenant Building
Maximum Quantity 1 per facade, not to exceed 4 cumulatively
Sign’s Setback from ROW Up to 50 ft 51 - 100 ft 101 - 150 ft 151 - 200 ft 201 - 250 ft 251+ ft
Maximum Sign Area per Facade 10 sq ft 27 sq ft 52 sq ft 85 sq ft 126 sq ft 150 sq ft
Maximum Sign Height 80% of the height of a spandrel panel or 10 feet, whichever is less
Changeable Copy Ratio 40% of the sign area may be changeable copy
Maximum Projection From Building 18 inches
Wall Signs Multiple-tenant Building
Maximum Quantity 1 per facade, not to exceed 4 cumulatively
Sign’s Setback from ROW Up to 50 ft 51 - 100 ft 101 - 150 ft 151 - 200 ft 201 - 250 ft 251+ ft
Maximum Sign Area per Facade 10 sq ft 27 sq ft 52 sq ft 85 sq ft 126 sq ft 150 sq ft
Maximum Sign Height 80% of the height of a spandrel panel or 10 feet, whichever is less
Changeable Copy Ratio 40% of the sign area may be changeable copy
Maximum Projection From Building 18 inches
a. Changeable Copy: Not permitted.
b. Illumination: Wall signs may be illuminated internally or externally.
c. Multiple-tenant Building Consistency: The sign envelope that tenants may use and the regulations to
maintain consistent sign appearance shall be identified during the permitting process. The sign envelope
shall not exceed 150% of the allowable wall sign area for each tenant space.

Article 5: Development Standards 5-107
Sign Standards (SI) 5
C. Temporary Signs: Any combination of standard temporary and special temporary signs shall be permitted for
single-tenant buildings and multiple-tenant buildings provided the following conditions are met.
1. Location: Temporary signs shall be located outside the Vision Clearance Triangle and a minimum of ten (10)
feet from any right-of-way, or edge of pavement associated with a street or driveway.
2. Illumination: Temporary signs shall not be illuminated.
3. Standard Temporary Signs: Standard temporary signs shall be permitted provided the following conditions are
met. The following conditions apply to single-tenant buildings and multiple-tenant buildings unless otherwise
specified.
a. Type: A standard temporary sign shall be an A-frame sign, self-standing sign, or yard sign. Examples of
standard temporary signs include sale of property, special sale, and special offer signs.
b. Quantity:
i. Single-tenant Buildings: One (1) standard temporary sign shall be permitted per lot frontage, plus one
(1) additional sign for each 300 feet of street frontage. For corner lots, no two (2) standard temporary
signs on separate frontages shall be closer than 150 feet, measured using the shortest tangent.
ii. Multiple-tenant Buildings: One (1) standard temporary sign shall be permitted for each tenant.
c. Sign Area: The sign area for a standard temporary sign shall not exceed thirty-two (32) square feet per side.
d. Height Above Ground: The sign copy of a standard temporary sign shall be no more than eight (8) feet above
the ground. The sign structure shall not be greater than 120% taller than the sign copy.
e. Duration: A standard temporary sign may stay in place for the duration of the temporary event. The
standard temporary sign may be put in place up to seven (7) days prior to the temporary event. All
standard temporary signs shall be taken down within five (5) days after the standard temporary sign’s
purpose no longer exists.
4. Special Temporary Signs: Special temporary signs shall be permitted provided the following conditions are
met. The following conditions apply to single-tenant buildings and multiple-tenant buildings unless otherwise
specified.
a. Type: Special temporary signs shall include banner signs, yard signs, A-frame signs, or self-standing signs.
Examples for the use of a special temporary sign include a community event or special services being
offered.
b. Quantity:
i. Single-tenant Buildings: Two (2) special temporary signs shall be permitted at any one (1) time for a lot.
ii. Multiple-tenant Buildings: One (1) special temporary sign shall be permitted for each building at any
given time.
c. Sign Area: The sign area for a special temporary sign shall not exceed fifty (50) square feet per side.
d. Height Above Ground: A special temporary sign shall not exceed eight (8) feet above the ground if
freestanding, or no higher than the roofline if mounted to a building.
e. Pennants, Streamers, and Strings of Flags: Pennants, streamers, and strings of flags without commercial
messages or branding may be used in any quantity and at any height on the site in addition to the special
temporary signs listed above. However, the duration shall comply with the following provision.
f. Duration: A special temporary sign may stay in place for seven (7) continuous days, no more than four (4)
times in any calendar year.

Sign Standards (SI) 5
5.78 SI-13: Industrial Sign Standards
This Sign Standards (SI) section applies to the following zoning districts:
The following standards apply:
A. Project Applicability:
1. Single-tenant Building:
a. Permanent Signs: Wall, ground, awning, and window signs shall be permitted for single-tenant buildings
provided the conditions specified for single-tenant buildings are met, and the cumulative square footage of
all permanent signs does not exceed two (2) square feet of sign area per linear foot of front facade or the
cumulative maximum as prescribed in the tables below for each type of sign, whichever is less.

buildings provided the conditions specified for single-tenant buildings are met.

a. Permanent Signs: Wall, gateway, awning, and window signs shall be permitted for multiple-tenant
buildings provided the conditions specified for multiple-tenant buildings are met, and the cumulative
square footage of all permanent signs does not exceed two (2) square feet of sign area per linear foot of front
facade, or the cumulative maximum as prescribed in the tables below for each type of sign, whichever is
less.
b. Temporary Signs: Standard temporary and special temporary signs shall be permitted for multiple-tenant
buildings provided the conditions specified for multiple-tenant buildings are met.
B. Permanent Signs: Permanent signs shall be permitted as follows:
1. Wall Signs: Wall signs shall be permitted on single-tenant buildings and multiple-tenant buildings provided the
following conditions are met. All wall signs shall count toward the maximum cumulative square footage for
permanent signs.

Maximum Sign Height 80% of the height of a spandrel panel or 20 feet, whichever is less
Changeable Copy Ratio 40% of the sign area may be changeable copy

Article 5: Development Standards 5-109
Sign Standards (SI) 5
2. Ground Signs: Ground signs shall be permitted on single-tenant buildings provided the following conditions
are met. See Subsection 5.78(B)(3) Gateway Signs below for multiple-tenant buildings. All ground signs
shall be counted toward the maximum cumulative square footage for permanent signs. Ground Signs are not

Ground Sign Single-tenant Building
Maximum Quantity 1; or 2 for corner lots with a minimum of 500 feet of combined street frontage

a. Double-sided: If a ground sign has two (2) identical sides, back-to-back, only one (1) side’s area counts
toward the maximum cumulative square footage.
b. Location: A ground sign shall be located as follows:
i. Outside the Vision Clearance Triangle; and
ii. The leading edge of the sign shall be at least five (5) feet but no greater than ten (10) feet from the
street right-of-way; and
iii. All portions of the sign shall be at least five (5) feet from the side property line or edge of pavement.
c. Sign Separation: When two (2) ground signs are permitted on the same lot, they shall be 200 feet or more
from each other, measured using the shortest tangent and located along different street frontages.
d. Changeable Copy: If changeable copy is used, it shall be an integrated component of the sign and shall
only utilize cyclical messages or static messages, regardless if the sign is capable of animated messages.
e. Illumination: A ground sign may be illuminated internally or by externally-mounted ground lighting.
3. Gateway Signs: Gateway signs shall be permitted for multiple-tenant buildings that have a minimum of two (2)
tenant spaces, and provided the following conditions are met. See Subsection 5.78(B)(2) Ground Signs above
for single-tenant buildings. All gateway signs shall be counted toward the maximum cumulative square footage
for permanent signs. Gateway Signs are not permitted for single-tenant buildings.

Maximum Quantity 1; or 2 for corner lots with a minimum of 800 feet of combined street frontage

Changeable Copy Ratio 40% of sign area may be changeable copy
a. Double-sided: If a gateway sign has two (2) identical sides, back-to-back, only one (1) side’s area counts
toward the maximum cumulative square footage.
b. Location: A gateway sign shall be located outside the Vision Clearance Triangle and a minimum of ten
(10) feet from any existing or proposed right-of-way, or edge of pavement associated with a street or
driveway; and a gateway sign shall be setback ten (10) feet from all property lines.
c. Changeable Copy: If changeable copy is used, it shall be an integrated component of the sign and shall
only utilize cyclical messages or static messages, regardless if the sign is capable of animated messages.
d. Illumination: A gateway sign may be illuminated internally or by externally-mounted ground lighting.
4. Awning Signs: Awning signs shall be permitted on single-tenant buildings and multiple-tenant buildings
provided the following conditions are met. All awning signs shall be counted toward the maximum cumulative
square footage for permanent signs.

Sign Standards (SI) 5
a. Illumination: Awning signs may be illuminated with internally or externally-mounted lights.
b. Operability: Awnings, with an awning sign, that can retract shall count toward the cumulative sign area
whether in the retracted or extended position.
5. Window Signs: Window signs shall be permitted on single-tenant buildings and multiple-tenant buildings
provided the following conditions are met. Window signs shall not be counted toward the maximum cumulative

or 30% of all ground floor windows fully
covered with signs
Either 30% of the area of each window,
or 30% of all ground floor windows fully
covered with signs
Height Above Ground 14 feet maximum 14 feet maximum
C. Temporary Signs: Any combination of standard temporary and special temporary signs shall be permitted for
single-tenant buildings and multiple-tenant buildings provided the following conditions are met.
1. Location: Temporary signs shall be located outside the Vision Clearance Triangle and a minimum of ten (10)
feet from any right-of-way, or edge of pavement associated with a street or driveway.
2. Illumination: Temporary signs shall not be illuminated.
3. Standard Temporary Signs: Standard temporary signs shall be permitted provided the following conditions are
met. The following conditions apply to single-tenant buildings and multiple-tenant buildings unless otherwise
specified.
a. Type: A standard temporary sign shall be an A-frame sign, self-standing sign, or yard sign. Examples of
standard temporary signs include sale of property, special sale, and special offer signs.
b. Quantity:
i. Single-tenant Buildings: One (1) standard temporary sign shall be permitted per lot frontage, plus one
(1) additional sign for each 300 feet of street frontage. For corner lots, no two (2) standard temporary
signs on separate frontages shall be closer than 150 feet, measured using the shortest tangent.
ii. Multiple-tenant Buildings: One (1) standard temporary sign shall be permitted for each tenant.
c. Sign Area: The sign area for a standard temporary sign shall not exceed thirty-two (32) square feet per side.
d. Height Above Ground: The sign copy of a standard temporary sign shall be no more than ten (10) feet above
the ground. The sign structure shall not be greater than 120% taller than the sign copy.
e. Duration: A standard temporary sign may stay in place for the duration of the temporary event. The
standard temporary sign may be put in place up to seven (7) days prior to the temporary event. All
standard temporary signs shall be taken down within five (5) days after the standard temporary sign’s
purpose no longer exists.
4. Special Temporary Signs: Special temporary signs shall be permitted provided the following conditions are
met. The following conditions apply to single-tenant buildings and multiple-tenant buildings unless otherwise
specified.
a. Type: Special temporary signs shall include banner signs, yard signs, A-frame signs, or self-standing
signs. Examples for the use of a special temporary sign include a community event or new product
announcement.
b. Quantity:
i. Single-tenant Buildings: Two (2) special temporary signs shall be permitted at any one (1) time for a lot.
ii. Multiple-tenant Buildings: One (1) special temporary sign shall be permitted for each building at any
given time.
c. Sign Area: The sign area for a special temporary sign shall not exceed fifty (50) square feet per side.
d. Height Above Ground: A special temporary sign shall not exceed eight (8) feet above the ground if
freestanding, or no higher than the roofline if mounted to a building.
e. Pennants, Streamers, and Strings of Flags: Pennants, streamers, and strings of flags without commercial
messages or branding may be used in any quantity and at any height on the site in addition to the special
temporary signs listed above. However, the duration shall comply with the following provision.
f. Duration: A special temporary sign may stay in place for seven (7) continuous days, no more than four (4)
times in any calendar year.

Article 5: Development Standards 5-111
Sign Standards (SI) 5
5.79 SI-14: Regional Outdoor Sign Standards
This Sign Standards (SI) section applies to the following zoning districts:
The following standards apply:
1. Display Board Signs: Scoreboards and video display signs, permanently affixed bulletin boards, or encased
display boards for posting at special events and/or performances.
a. Maximum Quantity: No maximum
b. Maximum Sign Area: No maximum
c. Height Above Ground: Thirty (30) feet maximum
d. Placement: All display board signs must be directed inward of the facility toward spectators.
e. Lighting: All display board signs shall be so shaded, shielded, or directed that the light intensity or
brightness will not be objectionable to the surrounding areas.
2. Facility Signs:
a. Maximum Quantity: One (1) per street frontage
b. Maximum Sign Area: 200 square feet
c. Height Above Ground: Thirty-five (35) feet maximum
d. Changeable Copy Signs: Changeable copy is permitted in this Ordinance in the regional outdoor entertainment
district, provided that the changeable copy surface area shall not cover more than forty percent (40%)
of any sign.
3. Gateway Signs:
a. Maximum Quantity: One (1) per entrance
b. Maximum Sign Area: Nine (9) square feet per side
c. Height Above Ground: Nine (9) feet maximum
d. Location: A gateway sign shall be located a minimum of five (5) feet from all property lines.
e. Lighting: Gateway signs shall not be illuminated.
f. Sponsorship and Event Information: Sponsorship and event information shall be permitted on gateway signs.
4. Sponsorship Signs:
a. Maximum Quantity: No maximum
b. Maximum Sign Area: No maximum
c. Height Above Ground: Sixty-five (65) feet maximum
d. Location: A sponsorship sign shall be located a minimum of 325 feet from all property lines.
e. Lighting: Sponsorship signs shall not be illuminated.
f. Temporary Signs:
i. Types: Permitted temporary signs include fence banners and inflatables.
ii. Duration: Temporary signs shall only be permitted two (2) days prior to the start of an event, during
an event, and two (2) days after an event ends.
